h3.Problem

Confluence CAN'T handle this kind of file inside a Word filetype.

Uploading a WMF File type will get your WMF Unrenderable.

There seems to be a problem with wmf files, they are just being ignored by their extension and are viewed as png, getting unrenderable.

Unable to render embedded object: File (test.png) not found.
Attached file was test.wmf

h3.Solution

None yet.

h3.Workaround

Don't embedded this kind of file types, for now at least.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39163].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
When using the office connector and editing/updating a document, the page 'modified date' does not update after the change.  This is a request to update the 'modified date' of the Confluence Page when an office document is edited.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Log into Confluence with Firefox or Internet Explorer
* Create a new page and 'edit' it.
* Create a test Office (excel was what I used) document with test data and copy the document to the new page while in 'edit' mode.
* Save the page
* (You will need to wait a few minutes so the 'last modified date' is a few minutes previous)
* Click 'Edit Document'
* Make a change to the test office document
* Save the document

h2. Expected Result
The page 'date modified' will be updated when the office document is saved

h2. Actual Result
The page 'date modified' is unchanged after saving the office document.

h2. Environment
Windows 7
Firefox and Internet Explorer
Confluence 5.4.2 (I believe this is all versions)

h2. Other Notes
We are aware that the 'date modified' on the attachments page does get updated when a change is made.  This request is to update the Confluence page 'date modified' to reflect this information as well.
fields.summary: Update the Confluence Page Date Modified After Updating an Office Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39154].
  {panel}

When creating or editing a page in Confluence 3.5.17 in IE7, the Office Connector, (bundled version 2.0.13_backport), throws the following Java Script error:

AJS.Confluence.PropertyPanel.Macro is null or undefined

This version was released as part of the security advisory and therefore there is no further upgrade path for these customers.

*Workaround:* At this stage the only workaround is to downgrade the Office Connector to v1.18, but this is not advisable for anyone who's instance is accessible to the internet or available for public signup because this would expose the security vulnerability to any logged in user. However, this workaround would work for anyone who is using their Confluence internally and can trust their users.

Related Confluence issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26228
fields.summary: Java Script Error: "AJS.Confluence.PropertyPanel.Macro is null or undefined" in Internet Explorer 7

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39145].
  {panel}

1. Create a document in MS Word which includes a \{TOC\}\\
2. Import the document into Confluence\\
3. Go to the newly-created Confluence page and either "Edit in Word" or "Export to Word"

The dynamic \{TOC\} has been converted to a list of static \{HYPERLINK\}s

This means that the TOC will no longer update when the document is updated.

It would be better to convert the Word \{TOC\} field to a Confluence \{TOC\} macro.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
All contents in Microsoft Word will be underlined when showed in Confluence page using viewfile macro. This happens due to the use of Table of Contents in the word document itself. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a word document and insert contents. 
2. Use the Table of Contents accordingly in References tab. Then save it.
3. Attach the file into Confluence and use view file macro to view the content on the page.

h3. Testing
* Tested in Confluence 4.3.2 and Confluence 3.5.16. Issue happens in 4.3.2
* Tested using both .doc and .docx

h3. Workaround 
Remove Table of Contents table and enter them manually.
fields.summary: Contents get underlined when View File Macro shows Word document with Table of Contents in use

fields.description:
After simple and common user's actions:
# Create page
# In the creation dialog add attachment and insert {{viewxls}} macro for it
# Save page
# Edit page (ex. add a word at the end)

Activity stream macro will fail to find attached file after editing the page.

This KB article: [Viewfile Macro is Unable to Locate the Attachment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Viewfile+Macro+is+Unable+to+Locate+the+Attachment] is useless here.

Now, more detailed steps:
# Install clean Confluence (see Environment)
# Create space {{TST}}
# Rename page "TST Home" to "Home" (*optional* step)
# Edit page {{Home}} - insert {{Activity Stream}} macro with default settings
# Click {{Create}} button
# Page name = XLS, add attachment [^ActivityStreamTest.xls] and insert {{Office Excel}} macro with this attachment
# Click {{Save}} button
# It is OK here
!JustAfterPageCreation.png!
!JustAfterPageCreationThePage.png!
# Edit {{XLS}} page - add some text to the end. Save page. Here is the problem:
!JustAfterEdit_TheActivityStream.png!
# The page looks good:
!JustAfterEdit_ThePage.png!
# BUT, if I go to the page's history and open first version of page, I'll see the same error:
!JustAfterEdit_HistoryVersion1.png!

*UPD*: Problem in Activity Stream still exists after deleting the XLS-file and reattaching it again.
fields.summary: Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : The viewfile macro is unable to locate the attachment in ActivityStream and History, if the file and macro was inserted on page creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39131].
  {panel}

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24965 - chose the wrong project

Importing Word (97 - 2003 *.DOC) Documents, created with Word 2007, works fine except for two things: Certain images look crappy, screenshots are rendered useless. This seems to happen for two things : 
a) Images are down scaled. This make them lose quality and, in some cases, make them unintelligible.
b) Not-PNG/JPG/GIF Images
See an example word doc and a resulting import. This makes the DOC-import for the majority of our documentation almost worthless. (See screenshot, which shows a very "well gone" import. There are images in our docs, who look TONS worse.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39128].
  {panel}

# create a word document with an image
# embed this document on a confluence page
## the image is visible when browsing the page
# export the confluence page (either word or pdf)
## the image is _not_ visible in the export

there is a related issue CONF-25599 concerning _only word_ exports.
Thus I assumed pdf export should actually work, but it does not.
Images generated by other plugins, like e.g. gliffy, are at least visible on the pdf exports (although word is not working either).

I also tried to include the image directly into the page (i.e. without wrapping it into a word document). In this case it is indeed visible on the pdf-export.

I attached a test document as well.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39121].
  {panel}

Importing Word (97 - 2003 *.DOC) Documents, created with Word 2007, works fine except for two things: Certain images look crappy, screenshots are rendered useless. This seems to happen for two things : 
a) large Images, which are not 100% size, 
b) Not-PNG/JPG/GIF Images

See an example word doc and a resulting import. This makes the DOC-import for the majority of our documentation almost worthless. (See screenshot, which shows a very "well gone" import. There are images in our docs, who look TONS worse.

fields.description:
The Excel Macro treats graph sheet as a single cell for text alignment, but displays the entire graph and covers text up.

See screenshots for a page in edit and view mode to see how the graph is overlapping the subsequent text.

Reproduction steps:
* Create page with 20+ lines of text
* Use Excel Macro to embed the attached excel sheet in the middle of the text

Expected behavior: 
* Graph should force text to appear below graph

Actual behavior:
* Graph displays over text

This affects Confluence 5.5.6 and Office Connector 3.3.8
fields.summary: Excel Macro renders graph over text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39118]. {panel} {viewfile} macro is no longer available from the list of available macros and existing viewfile macro can't be edited/updated. Also, for existing {viewfile} macro, in an Edit mode, when you choose the attachment it says: "(Not found)" and do not show the list of attachments from the specific page. See screen shot: !screen_01.png! h5. Workaround: Download and install [Confluence Source Editor plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] through UPM. Next, go to the page which has the {viewfile} macro, edit the page, on the editor you'll see this [<>] button in between 'binocular' button and the [?] button, click on it and a window will pop-up and you'll get something like this: {code}

Book1.xlsx

{code} You may edit this specific line: {code} {code} to {code} {code} and then click 'Apply'. This should transform the {viewfile} macro to {viewxls}. However, I'm afraid this still has to be done manually on each affected {viewfile} macro. OR you can also insert {viewxls} macro into Confluence page using Insert > Wiki Markup. The file will be displayed fine in Confluence page but still can't be successfully edited/updated. {viewxls}, {viewdoc}, {viewppt} macros are working as expected.
fields.summary: {viewfile} macro is no longer available from the list of available macros and existing viewfile macro can't be edited/updated
PowerPoint doc with custom height or width does not display in Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39115].
  {panel}

The ability to use the "Edit Document" button within the viewfile macro is based on page permissions rather than attachment permissions.

If a user has permission to add pages within a space but not to add attachments, they will be able to edit an attachment that's displayed using the viewfile macro.

If a user doesn't have permission to add pages, but has permission to add attachments, they will not be able to edit and attachment that's displayed using the viewfile macro, although they could download the file and replace it.

The current behavior is inconsistent and confusing.  It would be less confusing if the "add attachment" permission were renamed to "add/edit", and if the Office Connector allowed edits based on that permission instead of page permissions.
fields.summary: "Edit Document" permissions for viewfile macro are based on page permissions rather than attachment permissions...

fields.description:
Effectively, the quartz job is broken. To reproduce, you need to set the quartz job to run every couple minutes in the Atlassian plugin.xml file or leave your machine running overnight. 

An NPE should appear in the logs. It looks like the Quartz Job plugin module of the Office Connector is not being autowired.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39107].
  {panel}

I have a page with an included Excel file.
* open the file with "Edit in office" in Excel 2013.
* insert a hyperlink to your confluence instance
* save the file
* now "Edit in office" again
* Edit the hyperlink
* you will see the hyperlink is relative. In my case I pasted "http://mycompany.com/confluence/x/7S5VB" and now there is "../../../../../../x/7S5VB"
* BUT: the link now showing to "http://mycompany.com/x/7S5VB". The context path is not taken into account
So, I have to paste the links, save the file, edit it again and extend every hyperlink with the contextPath /confluence. That's quite annoying.

Can you fix the relative path?
fields.summary: Edit in Office breaks Confluence Hyperlinks in Excel

h5. another heading

Office Connector version: 3.1.4.4 and 3.3.3
Microsoft Office 2010 SP1 or SP2

When protected view is enabled in Microsoft Office 2010, saving changes on (some) file from internet (Edit In Office from Confluence) always asks for Merge.

Disable Protected view ([link|http://www.howtogeek.com/60310/enable-editing-for-all-office-2010-documents-by-disabling-protected-view/])

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39099].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
The "Edit Document" button sends the full URL of the attached Office document to Excel (or Word or PowerPoint), which can not open the URL because it is too long.

h3.Fix
Unfortunately there is none yet.

h3.Workaround
As a workaround, I was able to access the document by moving it up the page hierarchy and access it using the page parameter of viewfile.

While this is likely a WebDav or Office issue, it could possibly be resolved by using a tiny URL, rather than sending the entire URL to the Office application.

h3.notes
I noticed that other users have experienced the issue as well (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/View+File+Macro?focusedCommentId=187859664#comment-187859664), but I did not find a matching issue. I replied in the forum with my workaround.

(All info was provided by Daniel)

Headings in pages are automatically converted to Heading 1, if they are the highest order heading in the page (after splitting doc import).

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# {{Tools >> Import Word Document}}
# Import the attached {{document.doc}}, split by *Level 1 Headings*
!heading.jpg!

h3.Observed behavior
Notice that headings in the pages that are supposed to be *Heading 2*, are instead, set to *Heading 1*:
!heading2.jpg!

Same behavior for *Heading 3*:
!heading3.jpg!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39094].
  {panel}

When trying to import a Word document into Confluence that contains custom bullet points added to MS Word, you may encounter this exception:

{code}
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 1, Size: 1
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:547)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:322)
	at com.aspose.words.kd.dy(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.List.aF(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.ListFormat.getListLevel(Unknown Source)
	at com.benryan.dom.Doc2Wiki.visitParagraphStart(Doc2Wiki.java:453)
	at com.aspose.words.Paragraph.accept(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.CompositeNode.acceptChildren(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.Body.accept(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.CompositeNode.acceptChildren(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.Section.accept(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.words.CompositeNode.acceptChildren(Unknown Source)
{code}

I have attached an example file that just contains bullet points that should trigger the exception.

h3. Workaround
# Select all of the text in your document.
# Go to Format >> Bullets and Numbering...
# Choose one of the default bullet or numbering types that ships with MS Word.
# Save the document and attempt a new import into Confluence.

A word document is different when on page and inside microsoft word.
Please see attached "printscreen1" and "printscreen2" for detail.
Steps to reproduce(You may use the attached document to reproduce):
1. Attach the Word document to the page.
2. Use "Office Word" view macro to display the Word document.
3. Extra underlines are shown on the page(the 1st paragraph of the document)

Please advise

fields.description:
Confluence version: 5.3.4
Office Connector version: 3.1.3

Customer create a table in MS Excel and include a formula for calculation. However, the content of the table is not displayed correctly and showing error like {{#NAME?}}. refer to attachment _CSP115983_error.png_ for more details. The attached excel file, _example.xlsx_ consist of the data with formula that can be used to reproduce the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
# Compile an excel data with tables consist of excel formula (available from the excel file attachment)
# Attach the excel file to a Confluence page
# Insert Office Excel macro into the page
# Observe that the content of the table are not displayed correctly and showing error like {{#NAME?}}

The expected result is content displayed properly as shown on the original excel file.

fields.summary: Confluence OOMs when an invalid formula is entered into the spreadsheet macro

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce
(i) This only happens in Firefox
# Create a page titled *ěščř*
# Attach Office files
# Insert \{viewfile\} macro to view the attached Office files
# Edit them
!^FF.png!
# If it's Word document, it will open MS Word with a blank page
# If it's Excel spreadsheet, it will pop up the following warning:
!^excel.png!

The same thing happens if the Office file name contains special character.

h5. Workaround
* Use Internet Explorer
(i) IE will not work if you are using Office Connector 1.3.6 or lower due to [WORDDV-102|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/WORDDV-102]
or,
* Rename the page title or file name
fields.summary: Edit in Office is broken if page title or file name contains special characters
Webdav Launcher in update.atlassian.com is outdated, and does not support Firefox 5 and above

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39082].
  {panel}

Strikethrough is not showing on displayed Excel spreadsheet in viewfile macro

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Upload the attached Excel file as an attachment to the test Confluence page
# Add the Confluence Excel macro into the page

h4. Expected Behaviour
Strikethrough should be displayed

h4. Actual Behaviour 
Strikethrough is not showing
fields.summary: Strikethrough is not showing on displayed Excel spreadsheet in viewfile macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39081].
  {panel}

When opening a document in Confluence with a # in the title, a 500 error is thrown by the browser/editor.  In the logs this is seen as a null pointer exception due to the '#' being translated to %23.

The following is found in atlassian-confluence.logs
{code}
2012-01-17 09:29:14,527 ERROR [http-1413-4] [ContainerBase.[Standalone].[localhost].[/]] log Unhandled exception occurred whilst decorating page
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/confluence/editinword/589828/attachments/test%20 | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

There is a lot more to the total stack trace but that is the start, I have attached a text file containing the entire trace.  It looks as though Confluence attempts to open the document multiple times before giving up.

It may also be worth noting this affects office connector 1.18 in Confluence 3.5.13 as well but 1.18 was not available in the affected versions lists.

*To Reproduce*
* Create document with '#' in title
* Attach to a page in Confluence
* Click 'edit in office' for the document you have uploaded
* Observe error
fields.summary: Error 500 when editing document with '#' in the title
Auto-numbering new page fail if warning selected in Office Connector Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create new empty presentation in PowerPoint 2010 or 2013
# Insert - Object - From file - choose any file (pdf, another presentation, etc) - choose link creation instead of embedding
# Save as test.pptx (in the latest available format)
# Save as test.ppt (old 97-... format)
# Attach both test.ppt and test.pptx to an empty Confluence page
# Edit the page
# Insert two viewppt macros and select both attached files for them
# Save the page


h3. Expected Behaviour:
Both of the viewfile macro is rendered.

h3. Observed Behavour.
The viewfile macro for the .pptx does not render its content.

Additionally, the following stacktrace appear in the logs:
See that test.ppt is rendered correctly (ignoring broken object link), but test.pptx is not.

The following stacktrace also appear in the logs. 
{code}
2014-10-21 17:18:18,163 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-2] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting test.pptx
 -- referer: http://10.60.2.176:5130/display/ASD/test | url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
java.lang.RuntimeException: org.apache.poi.openxml4j.exceptions.InvalidFormatException: Absolute URI forbidden: file:///C:/Users/obrush/Documents/Concurrency%20in%20multithreading%20-%201.pptx
{code}

Tested  with Confluence 5.5 and 5.6.3 with office connector 3.3.8.
fields.summary: Office Connector does not render PPTX with external link

fields.summary: Graphs in xls file causes high CPU load and eventually OOME
Improve supportability of Windows 7 and the Office Connector
asd

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39075].
  {panel}

Known issue in the pdf-renderer library:

https://pdf-renderer.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=111
https://pdf-renderer.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=91

According to a comment on https://pdf-renderer.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=111 this might be fixed in CVS HEAD of the pdf-renderer library (needs to be confirmed and backported).
fields.summary: PDF viewfile macro: Text displayed upside down for certain PDFs

fields.description: As discussed in CONF-20506 the Edit in Office link points to a URL provided by the WEBDAV plugin, and through [WBDV-52|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/WBDV-52], this is often too long for Office running on Windows to open.
fields.summary: Edit in Office URLs are often too long to open in Office

fields.description:
The view PDF macro does not work in comments, it is using the pageManager to resolve the id of the content, this causes a ClassCastException when used in a comment, should use ContentEntityManager

fields.description:
Microsoft Office lets you embed, for example, an Excel graph into a Powerpoint presentation. It is stored as an editable Excel object instead of a static picture. 
When the powerpoint is added to a Confluence page, the slides that contain embedded Excel graphs appear empty. See screenshots !Excel_in_powerpoint.png|thumbnail! and !Excel_in_powerpoint_on_wiki.png|thumbnail!

This was confirmed on a clean install of Confluence 5.5.6 via Docker with version 3.3.8 of Office Connector
fields.summary: MS Office macro does not render embedded Objects in other Objects

fields.description:
The {{editinword}} servlet calls its own authenticator even after Seraph's SecurityFilter has logged in the user.  

Even if there is a need for re-authenticating a request(such as to secure the WebDAV-enabled save target that Word is given...?), there is never any valid reason to use different code to do it.

Assuming that the choice to authenticate a request after the {{SecurityFilter}} has already done so is not a design flaw, I still note two problems, both of which come into play in producing the presenting symptoms:

# Despite the authenticated user being present in both the session and the {{ThreadLocal User}} object, the plugin does not find them when it does its authorization check, which will then fail if anonymous updates are forbidden (I suspect that this is the reason the plugin has a configuration option to require authentication).
# If an authenticated user is not found (which will always be the case, apparently) and the above-mentioned option is true (its default value), {{com.benryan.servlet.webdav.ZenWebDavServlet.authenticate()}} is called.  I haven't learned exactly how it does its job, but have observed two things: first, that it does not call the Seraph-configured authenticator; second, that it goes to the {{Authorization}} header for the credentials.  The second is probably innocuous, since Word is only able to use HTTP Basic authentication, but the first is unquestionably wrong.

Of course, if the default authenticator is used, this will not be a problem; it will simply validate the same credentials against the same sources, _ergo_ with the same result.  If, however, a custom authenticator is used that does not behave exactly like the default one, the result is that successfully authenticated and duly authorized requests are nevertheless refused by the plugin.

The custom authenticator would thus appear to be the culprit.  However, I can tell you with certainty that it is not; what I describe above _also occurs with the default authenticator_, though it takes a debugger to confirm it.

My considered opinion is that the root of the problem is the plugin's inability to retrieve the user from either the AuthenticationContext or the session attribute where SecurityFilter stores it.  If there's any way you can suggest to repair or bypass that problem, it would be wonderful.  I've been fighting this problem for over a year now and am very frustrated.
fields.summary: Office Connector ignores result of authentication, calls its own authenticator

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39065].
  {panel}

A single backslash "\" character in Excel sheet is not showing in ViewExcel. Two or three backslashes are shown as only one backslash in ViewExcel. Four backlashes are shown as two backslashes in ViewExcel

Reproducible in 2.0.14 and 2.0.15. *NOT* reproducible in Office Connector 2.1.4 and 2.1.7.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Attach [^test.xlsx] into a page
# Insert a View Excel macro and choose the attached page
The Excel should be shown as:
!screenshot.jpg!
Instead, it's showing as:
!screenshot2.jpg!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Language settings about email notifications of sharing pages on Confluence

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.6.3
* Confluence 5.6.5
* Confluence 5.8.10 (Latest)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set *Global Default Language* to Japanese (any language aside from English is affordable)
# Set *default language of the user* who receives email notification to English
# Share any page to the user

h3. Expected Results
* The subject of the email is in English
* The body of the email is in English

h3. Actual Results
* The subject of the email is in *Japanese* like '○○ はあなたと ×× を共有しました'
* The body of the email is in English like '○○ shared a page with you'
fields.summary: Language settings about email notifications of sharing pages on Confluence
